titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the South Brooklyn Savings Bank records 2007.001
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik and John Zarrillo
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

physdesc.extent: in 60 boxes of various sizes and five loose objects

did.abstract: The collection consists of the records of the Board of Trustees of the South Brooklyn Savings Bank (originally known as the South Brooklyn Savings Institution, and later known as the Independence Savings Bank and the Independence Community Bank). These records include Board meeting minutes, financial records and reports, administrative files, photographs, scrapbooks, and memorabilia. The records span the entire history of the bank, from its founding in 1850 through 2006 (the year the bank was acquired by Sovereign Bank).

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The South Brooklyn Savings Institution was found in Brooklyn, NY, in 1850. The institution formally channged its name to the South Brooklyn Savings Bank in 1930. The bank's main branch was located at the corner of Atlantic Avenue and Court Street. Another major branch was located at 18th Avenue and 65th Street. In 1975, the bank formally changed its name to the Independence Savings Bank. In 1992, "the bank reorganized into [a] mutual holding company." The bank underwent further reorganization 1997, and formally changed its name to Independence Community Bank Corp. Finally, the bank was acquired by Soveriegn Bank in 2006.

Independence Community Bank was founded in Brooklyn, N.Y. in 1850 as The South Brooklyn Savings Institution. It was bought out by Sovereign Bank in 2006. After the buyout, the Brooklyn Historical Society, with the support of the Independence Community Foundation (now the Brooklyn Community Foundation), conducted 16 extended interviews with past and present employees of Independence Community Bank to document the end of the Bank's 155 years based in Brooklyn.

The South Brooklyn Savings Institution was founded in Brooklyn, New York, in 1850. The institution formally changed its name to the South Brooklyn Savings Bank in 1930. The bank's main branch was located at the corner of Atlantic Avenue and Court Street. Another major branch was located at 18th Avenue and 65th Street. The bank expanded throughout the 20th century, with offices located in Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, the Bronx, and Nassau County, New York. In 1975, the bank formally changed its name to the Independence Savings Bank. In 1992, "the bank reorganized into [a] mutual holding company." The bank underwent further reorganization in 1997, and formally changed its name to Independence Community Bank Corp. In 2006, the bank was acquired by Sovereign Bancorp, Inc.

list.head: Sources
list.item: South Brooklyn Savings Bank One Hundredth Anniversary booklet, 1950
Independence Community Bank Corp. - U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission report, 2000

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into five series:
Series 1: Board of Trustees meeting minutes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the records of the Board of Trustees of the South Brooklyn Savings Bank (originally known as the South Brooklyn Savings Institution, and later known as the Independence Savings Bank and the Independence Community Bank). These records include Board meeting minutes, financial records and reports, administrative files, photographs, scrapbooks, and memorabilia. The records span the entire history of the bank, from its founding in 1850 through 2006 (the year the bank was acquired by Sovereign Bank).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Historical Society holds the following related collections:

list.head: Missing Title
list.item: South Brooklyn Savings Institution trustees photographic portrait albums, 1850-1922 (ARC.215).
Independence Community Bank Presidential Portrait Collection, 1850-1973 (M2007.023)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); South Brooklyn Savings Bank records, 2007.001, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was minimally processed by Nicholas Pavlik, who authored the first version of this finding aid, in October 2011. In December 2014, the collection was arranged into series by John Zarrillo, who subsequently revised and expanded the finding aid in February 2015.

These records were originally combined and described collectively with the Independence Community Bank oral histories (2008.032) as ARC.269. The two collections were separated due to their distinct provenance in June 2015.

Between September and December 2019, boxes 21 through 60 were minimally processed, and incorporated into the finding aid in January 2020. These materials were found in the collection with minimal identifying information. These materials may be accession 2015.022, but seem to be a seperate grouping of materials based on the existing description of accession 2015.022.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for photographs have not been established. Please consult library staff for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Independence Community Bank Corp., 2007.

did.unittitle: Series 1: Board of Trustees and Committee meeting minutes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains Board of Trustee meeting minutes, dating from the 1850s through the 1960s. Executive Committee meeting minutes (1877-1966) document the decision-making and policies which led to the bank's success and expansion from 1850 to 1966. This series also include minutes from the Finance, Investment, and Buildings committees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains financial records and reports dating from 1850 to 2000. It includes financial ledgers, tax documents, Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation reports, NYS Bank exampinations, reports to the Board of Trustees, and financial statements.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is generally arranged chronologically by date.

did.unittitle: Contracts SBSB and Various Mortgage Guarentee Cos

odd.head: General
odd.p: Ledger contains a mix of organizational and financial records. The following items are listed in its index: Organization of bank, Trustees when elected, Offices, Interest to depositors, Panics, Amount due depositors, Bonds and mortgages, Employees of bank, Finances committees, Executive committees, Examining committees, Interest on securities, and Receipt and payments from 1850

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series represents a small collection of files which were produced by the Board of Trustees and various administrative departments throughout the history of the bank, dating from 1883 to 2006.

It contains property titles (1886-1892), public relations and advertising files (1937-2005), building and renovation files (1930-1977), copies of 1850 and 1859 articles of incorporaton, one file on the 2006 acquisition of the Independence Community Bank Corporation by Sovereign Bancorp, Inc., and other documents.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged chronologically by date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains photographs and scrapbooks documenting the bank from 1883 to 2001.

It includes numerous photographic portraits of bank trustees, in three albums, five folders, and one framed photograph (circa 1940-2001). Additionally, the series contains two scrapbooks documenting the lives of trustees (1922-1982).
It contains two clippings scrapbooks (1883-1920) and five advertising scrapbooks (1931-1953).

Other photographs include bank baseball teams (circa 1930), the corner of Atlantic Avenue and Court Street (circa 1920), the bank's 90th anniversary (1940), Christmas celebrations (1951-1952), and bank openings (circa 1960).

did.unittitle: Corner of Atlantic Avenue and Court Street photographs
South Brooklyn Savings Bank baseball team
Trustees at NASDAQ MarketSite, Times Square (framed)
Board of Trustees portrait albums (3 albums)

odd.head: General
odd.p: Albums feature portraits of Board of Trustees dating back to 1850. The first and second albums appear to have been created around 1940, with additional material added to the albums until around 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains bank memorabilia, dating from around the 1920s to 2004. It primarily consists of objects relating the bank's sports teams, including trophies for Brooklyn bank baseball, basketball, and bowling leagues (1930s and 1970s). Other objects include a wood block stamp of the bank's 18th Avenue branch building (circa 1920s-1940s), radio advertisment 12" vinyl records (circa 1950s), advertising awards (1970s), and paperweights commemorating the bank's stock valuations (1992-2004).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is generally arranged chronologically by date.
